summary:
While they agreed that as young girls they might have been influenced by movies and expected that kind of cinematic experience, when they actually started experiencing love or felt the emotion, it was not the Bollywood gimmicks they fell for, but rather for the:

Openness in communication
Understanding
Appreciation
Friendship that didn’t judge them
Women cutely set the bare minimum to things like:

Having a nice bowl of Maggi together
Watching a movie together after a hectic day of work
Even small, noticeable attempts by their partner to spend some quality time with them and talk about how their day went
All the responses were singing a chorus of the same ask:

Being able to completely trust someone and spend some quality time with them. Many responses echoed:

“We are in this together ❤️”

Some women are noticeably head over heels, as their response said:

“I might have had high standards set for my partner, but you make it look like it’s the bare minimum.”

Others said:

“I love you more than I could ever try and express.”

That’s all I had asked my beautiful women — and aren’t they sweet?! There was one answer that I appreciated — even while not trying to be biased or judgmental — and it goes:

“I do express to know if I’m fooling myself or if the other person feels something too.”

Trust me, this can save young girls and emotionally invested women from a lot of sadness that could come from heartbreaks or one-sided love. One respondent put it powerfully:

“Love can be unconditional, but relationships are a bit conditional — they’re about walking together, adjusting, surviving.”

Love was also described as comfort, companionship, and emotional safety. Emotional intimacy is a key foundation of a healthy relationship — it builds trust, provides emotional security, relieves stress, and can ultimately make or break the relationship, forming the base of love itself.

While they agreed that as young girls they might have been influenced by movies and expected that kind of cinematic experience, when they actually started experiencing love or felt the emotion, it was not the Bollywood gimmicks they fell for, but rather for the:

Openness in communication
Understanding
Appreciation
Friendship that didn’t judge them
Women cutely set the bare minimum to things like:

Having a nice bowl of Maggi together
Watching a movie together after a hectic day of work
Even small, noticeable attempts by their partner to spend some quality time with them and talk about how their day went
All the responses were singing a chorus of the same ask:

Being able to completely trust someone and spend some quality time with them.

There was one answer that I appreciated — even while not trying to be biased or judgmental — and it goes:

“I do express to know if I’m fooling myself or if the other person feels something too.”

Trust me, this can save young girls and emotionally invested women from a lot of sadness that could come from heartbreaks or one-sided love.

It is about sharing thoughts, fears, pain, and happiness without fear of judgment, feeling safe to be vulnerable, and feeling emotionally connected.”

Mental and emotional presence matters more than physical presence, and a strong emotional bond can sustain even long-distance relationships.
